quoteLast: simultaneous readings are taken at all weather bureau stations of the country. On the coast, where the time is three hours different than at New York, the readings are taken at 4:40, so that the hour corresponds at all places. At 8:00 A. M.
title: Gilbert Weather Bureau (Meteorology) for Boys
author: Gilbert, A. C. (Alfred Carlton), 1884-1961

quoteFirst: Breakfast in Fillmore Street, never a lively meal, was more dismal than usual that morning, eaten to the accompaniment of slopping water from the roofs on the pavement of the passage. The indisposition of Lise passed unobserved by both Hannah and Edward; and at
quoteLast: the two girls, with rubbers and umbrellas, left the house together, though it was Janet's custom to depart earlier, since she had farther to go. Lise, suspicious, maintained an obstinate silence, keeping close to the curb.
title: Project Gutenberg Complete Works of Winston Churchill

quoteLast: and, although dinner was at seven-thirty, the room was full.  Everybody stared at her as with flushed cheeks she walked to the centre of the room.

quoteLast: and at six and three-quarter miles distant got to Mallapoorponannie sand range, the southern end of which is called Cookorda; about two miles off its northern end dwindles down to nothing in the desert. To the northern end of Coontarie sand range a creek and well by the same name; about twelve miles off a detached sand range in the desert, at the north-west end of which are two waters named respectively Dhooramoorco and Moongaara; also on north-east side of sand range another water in creek called Caddryyerra, also a sand range about four to five miles distant.

quoteFirst: We were again delayed by trifling circumstances, and did not leave the camp until
quoteLast: , but having nearly cleared the desert the weather was comparatively cool. Steering an average course north-east, traversed the wide grassy plains on the right bank of Sturt's Creek, to which the name of Denison's Plains was given. At 2.0 p.m. camped at a small pool in the polygonum flat, which was all that remained of the water which had covered the flat to the extent of three-quarters of a mile in breadth, and was running when we passed down last month.
title: Journals of Australian Explorations
author: Gregory, Augustus Charles, 1819-1905; Gregory, Francis Thomas, 1821-1888
